name: Jiaxin Mao
content: maojiaxinSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationJiaxin Mao's HomepageJiaxin Mao  Pre-tenure Associate Professor at Renmin University of ChinaMy name is Jiaxin Mao (毛佳昕, in Chinese). I am now a pre-tenure associate professor at the Gaoling School of Artificial Intelligence, Renmin University of China. Before that, I worked as a postdoctoral research fellow and obtained my Ph.D. degree at the Department of Computer Science and Technology at Tsinghua University under the supervision of Prof. Shaoping Ma and Prof. Yiqun Liu. My research focuses on Information Retrieval, Web Search, and Applied Machine Learning. I am particularly interested in how people interact with the massive amount of information on the Web, so I focus on User Behavior Analysis for different information systems, such as search engines, recommender systems, and AI chatbots. Recently, I have also become interested in building effective and efficient dense retrieval models for ad hoc search.I am the ACM SIGIR Student Affairs Co-Chair since 2018 and served as an ACM SIGIR Student Liaison during 2017-2018, please contact me if you have any questions about SIGIR-student matters. I also served as a reviewer and SPC/PC member for TOIS, TKDE, JASIST, SIGIR, WWW, WSDM, AAAI, CIKM, EMNLP-IJCNLP, ECIR, NLPCC, and CCIR.Professional Experience:2023~Now  Renmin University of China, Pre-tenure Associate Professor2020~2023  Renmin University of China, Assistant Professor2018~2020 Tsinghua University, Post-doc Research FellowEducation:2013~2018  Ph.D.      Computer Science, Tsinghua University2009~2013  B.E.        Computer Science, Tsinghua UniversityContact info and some useful links:E-mail: maojiaxin AT {gmail.com, ruc.edu.cn}Official Homepage in Chinese: https://gsai.ruc.edu.cn/maojiaxintwitter: maojiaxinweibo: defaultstr9google scholar: Jiaxin MaoACM DL profile: Jiaxin MaoNews:I serve as one of the PC Chairs of SIGIR-AP 2024. Please see the Call for Papers.I serve as one of the PhD Symposium Chairs of CIKM 2024. See the Call for PhD Symposium.Jul 17, 2024: Our paper titled "Scaling Laws For Dense Retrieval" won the Best Paper Award of SIGIR 2024!.Jul 16, 2024: Our paper titled "CoSearchAgent: A Lightweight Collaborative Search Agent with Large Language Models" was selected as a nominee for the Best Short Paper Award of SIGIR 2024 (twitter).Feb 21, 2022: Our paper titled "Learning Discrete Representations via Constrained Clustering for Effective and Efficient Dense Retrieval" won the Best Paper Award of WSDM 2022 (link). Jul 29, 2020: Our paper titled "Models Versus Satisfaction: Towards a Better Understanding of Evaluation Metrics" won the Best Paper Honorable Mention Award of SIGIR 2020 (link).Oct 12, 2019: Our paper titled "Social Influence Analysis for Microblog User based on User Behavior" won the Chinese Journal of Computers Best Paper Award(2014-2018).Oct 04, 2019: Our paper titled "Investigating the Reliability of Click Models" won the Best Short Paper Honorable Mention Award of ICTIR 2019 (link).Jul 21, 2019: I gave a Tutorial titled "Explainable Recommendation and Search" with Yongfeng Zhang, Qingyao Ai, and Xu Chen at SIGIR 2019 in Paris (link).May 14, 2019: I gave a tutorial titled "Explainable Recommendation and Search" with Yongfeng Zhang and Qingyao Ai at the 2019 Web Conference in San Francisco (link).Oct 26, 2018: I gave a Tutorial titled "Unbiased Learning to Rank: Theory and Practice" with Qingyao Ai, Yiqun Liu, and W.
